text: Alfred Vaino Aho (born August 9, 1941) is a Canadian computer scientist. He is best known for his work on programming languages, compilers, and related algorithms. He has written many textbooks on the art and science of computer programming.Computerworld Interview with Alfred V. Aho He and his long-time partner Jeffrey Ullman are the recipients of the 2020 Turing Award. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:Living people Category:Canadian computer scientists Category:People from Timmins Category:Turing Award winners Category:University of Toronto alumni Category:Writers from Ontario
title: Alfred Aho
